text: We do publish the extension to the Open VSX Registry, but beyond that we don't follow up whether things work, are used etc. I just tried Theia on some cloud hosted thing, and it errored when it tried to activate the Julia extension, so I think the answer is probably "no". Probably best to ask these questions over in <#C6LV2R5JB|vscode>

text: I think if someone would want to make the extension compatible with Theia and maintain that, it would be great. Just speaking for myself, I don't see myself spending time on that, I want to use the time I have to make the extension as good as can be on VS Code. But, that shouldn't stop someone else :slightly_smiling_face: I can't speak for the rest of the team, but I also feel that focusing on the VS Code integration first is by far the most promising route at the moment for the "main" Julia IDE story. We will get many more features earlier that MS is working on, and that would presumably take a long time to make it into Theia. Plus, I think the upcoming GitHub Codespaces stuff is so important and fantastic that I have a very hard time seeing anything competing successfully with that, tbh...

text: But having said that, our whole LS stack for example is also used by many other IDEs, not just VS Code. The way this has played out is that volunteers have opened PRs that made sure the LS stuff works on non VS Code platforms. I could easily imagine a scenario where something similar happens for Theia, if someone wants to take on that role.
